decision.reasoning:
The market is pricing Seattle at 52.6%, but the best available ‚Äúwisdom of crowds‚Äù signal here is the betting market/analytics, and both lean notably higher than 52.6%.

- Multiple books are sitting around Seahawks -4.5 (and reporting early sharp-driven movement from -3 to -4.5). A -4.5 spread in an NFL game typically corresponds to roughly ~58‚Äì62% win probability, depending on total/variance assumptions. That alone suggests the fair YES price is meaningfully above 52.6%.
- ESPN Analytics cited at ~60.2% for Seattle also points to the same range.
- The public narrative (‚ÄúPatriots upset chances‚Äù, ‚ÄúSeahawks overrated‚Äù) is exactly the kind of thing that can keep a favorite‚Äôs market probability depressed in a binary prediction market even when the underlying team-strength signals still favor them.

So I see value on YES: if fair is ~60%, buying at 52.6% is a solid edge (~7 pts). Given my aggressive profile, I‚Äôm taking a large position.
